Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk audispd-plugins
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk audit
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: audit bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The audit packages contain the user-space utilities for storing and searching the audit records which have been generated by the audit subsystem in the Linux 2.6 kernel. The audit packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.4.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1142989) This update also fixes the following bugs: The "--bad" option of the "aulast" command reports unsuccessful logins. Previously, the output of the "aulast --bad --proof" command could be confusing. The command returned certain non-existing audit events, the "still logged in" message instead of the correct time of the unsuccessful login, and sometimes also two records per one unsuccessful login. With this update, the output has been modified to address the aforementioned bugs. (BZ#975796) Examples in the auditctl(8), audit.rules(7), and several other manual pages referred to the open() system call, which had been deprecated on certain architectures. The manual pages have been modified to refer to the newer system calls instead of open() where required. (BZ#1088593) Previously, the output of the "ausearch" command could be truncated and did not provide all information about the SELinux context. This update provides a patch to fix this bug, and "ausearch" now returns the correct output as expected. (BZ#1104973) Due to a bug in the get_line() function, the audispd utility failed to parse lines longer then 128 characters. The underlying source code has been modified, and audispd no longer fails in the described situation. (BZ#1105150) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: The AUDIT_SECCOMP event blocks system calls based on per application policy and records the system call that is being blocked. Each architecture or platform has its system calls numbered differently. The "arch=" field has been added to AUDIT_SECCOMP to enable decoding the system call number. To address this, several changes have been made to audit utilities. The ausearch utility can now interpret the number of the SECCOMP system call to its name and search for the call. Also, the aureport utility is now able to collect the SECCOMP system call in its report. (BZ#1073063) With this update, the audit subsystem is able to set the "loginuid" value immutable. (BZ#1087849) Users of audit are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
